definition: (onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]

sentences.english: Press the horn appeared in a hoarse voice of sand.
sentences.chinese: 按下喇叭出现沙哑声音沙。

sentences.english: Heard the hoarse voice, like leaves caress.
sentences.chinese: 听见沙哑的声音，如同树叶摩挲。

sentences.english: She is singing in the kitchen happily, though her voice is hoarse and out of tune.
sentences.chinese: 她在厨房里唱一支歌，她的声音沙哑，还有点跑调儿。

sentences.english: Don't you hear how hoarse I am.
sentences.chinese: 你听，我的声音多沙哑啊。

sentences.english: I also had GERD [gastroesophageal reflux disease], so I was hoarse all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我还有胃食管反流病，所以我的声音一直都很沙哑。

sentences.english: Their voices were hoarse, but they began yelling again.
sentences.chinese: 尽管声音沙哑，他们还是再次喊开了。

sentences.english: I have a runny nose, am sneezing and also have a scratchy throat.
sentences.chinese: 我流鼻水，打喷嚏并且喉咙沙哑。

sentences.english: Mother's voice rustles, wrinkling the silence.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的叫声沙哑，让寂静也起皱纹。

sentences.english: His breathing was hoarse, his face livid, his limbs flaccid , his belly prominent.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸声沙哑，脸色苍白，双腿无力，肚子鼓胀。

sentences.english: The hoarse tenor singer mucked up the recital.
sentences.chinese: 沙哑的男高音把音乐会搞砸了。

sentences.english: Is that clear? the captain asked in a gravelly voice.
sentences.chinese: 清楚了吗？队长用沙哑的声音要求道。

sentences.english: Our coach has a hoarse voice because he screamed too much.
sentences.chinese: 我们的教练因为太常大叫所以声音沙哑了。

sentences.english: His boastful throat soon grew hoarse with thirst, and he betook himself to prayer.
sentences.chinese: 不久，那夸口的喉咙因干渴而沙哑，他开始祈求。

sentences.english: Some voices are clear, others are more scratchy.
sentences.chinese: 有的很清朗，其他的更沙哑。

definition: high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
(onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
